page.title: 20Thomson's Monument
page.content: Joseph Thomson was born at Penpont 14th Feb 1858,and he died in London the 2nd of Aug 1895.He was buired in Thornhill,in Morton church yard.Joseph Thomson was a student at Edinburgh University.On leaving university he led many expeditions to Africa for the Royal Geographical Society in 1879_80 and 1883_84.In his second tour he passed through the Masai country and visited mt.Kenya,he also travelled in the Niger country,in Morocco and in the coutry north of Zambezi river.A great asset was his ability to get on friendly terms with hostile tribes.It was members of the Royal Geographical Society who were responsible for the erechion of the memorial which stands in Thornhill today.The momorial has a square sand stone base with bronze lion's head and a bronze plaque on each side.
